metadata.title: CVE-2021-38300 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
arch/mips/net/bpf_jit.c in the Linux kernel before 5.4.10 can generateundesirable machine code when transforming unprivileged cBPF programs,allowing execution of arbitrary code within the kernel context. This occursbecause conditional branches can exceed the 128 KB limit of the MIPSarchitecture.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38300` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-gke - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1002-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency - 5.15.0-22.22
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-22-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-22.22
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.17.0-1003-oem - 5.17.0-1003.3
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-1004-intel-iotg - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.0.0-1006-oem - 6.0.0-1006.6
No subscription required
